Penambahan RSUD, Dinkes Jabar Tunggu Kajian
05 Nov 2019, 05:24 by Ecep Sukirman
BANDUNG, (PR).- Terkait masih minimnya keberadaan RSUD (rumah sakit umum daerah) milik Provinsi Jawa Barat, Kepala Dinas Kesehatan Jawa Barat Berli Hamdani menjelaskan, untuk penambahan RSUD provinsi, saat ini hal itu masih dalam taraf kajian sesuai peraturan perundang-undangan yang berlaku.
Selain itu, kajian penambahan RSUD akan disetarakan dengan kemampuan keuangan daerah dan sumber lainnya yang sah.
Menurut dia, saat ini Dinas Kesehatan Jawa Barat terus mendorong RSUD provinsi yang sudah ada untuk meningkatkan dan mengembangkan pelayanan kesehatan sesuai kebutuhan dan kemampuan sumber daya rumah sakit tersebut.
“Khusus peningkatan layanan health coverage warga Jabar, layanan Kesehatan Semesta kita akomodasi melalui Layanan Layad Rawat dan Sistem Rujukan Terpadu secara berjenjang,” kata Berli, Selasa 5 November 2019.
Mengenai jumlah ideal RSUD, Berli tidak menjelaskan secara perinci.



RSUD hanya enam
DPRD Jawa Barat menyoroti masih kurangnya keberadaan RSUD milik Pemerintah Provinsi Jawa Barat. Saat ini, RSUD Pemerintah Provinsi Jawa Barat hanya berjumlah enam dengan sebaran kurang merata.
Anggota Komisi V DPRD Jawa Barat Asep Wahyuwijaya menuturkan, DPRD Jawa Barat sebenarnya sudah mendorong pihak eksekutif untuk menambah RSUD. Usulan penambahan RSUD, kata Asep, muncul untuk meningkatkan aksesibilitas pelayanan kesehatan masyarakat, terutama bagi masyarakat di wilayah yang jauh dari pusat kota.
“Semestinya, Dinas Kesehatan Jawa Barat juga proaktif meminta gubernur agar RSUD provinsi ditambah agar health coverage warga Jawa Barat bisa terlayani. Sekarang (RSUD milik provinsi) baru ada enam, tiga di antaranya adalah RSUD Pameungpeuk Garut, RSUD Al Ihsan Kabupaten Bandung, dan RSUD di Jampang Kulon Sukabumi,” kata Asep, Selasa 5 November 2019.
Dia mendorong Pemerintah Provinsi Jawa Barat menyediakan RSUD provinsi di lokasi-lokasi lain. Asep mencontohkan, di Kabupaten Bogor harus ada RSUD yang melayani 2 juta penduduk.
“Hak mendasar masyarakat di bidang kesehatan harus terus dioptimalkan. Seharusnya, Pemerintah Provinsi Jawa Barat melalui kebijakan Gubernur Jawa Barat Ridwan Kamil, lebih memprioritaskan pemenuhan hak dasar masyarakat, jangan mengalokasikan anggaran untuk program pupujieun yang dampaknya kurang dirasakan masyarakat,” ujar dia.***

Addition of RSUD, West Java Health Office Waiting for Study
05 Nov 2019, 05:24 by Ecep Sukirman
BANDUNG, (PR) .- Related to the still minimal existence of the RSUD (regional public hospital) owned by the Province of West Java, Head of the West Java Health Service, Berli Hamdani, explained that for the addition of the provincial hospital, the matter is currently still at the level of study in accordance with statutory regulations applicable.
In addition, studies on the addition of RSUD will be equalized with the ability of regional finances and other legal sources.
According to him, currently the West Java Health Service continues to encourage existing provincial hospitals to improve and develop health services according to the needs and capabilities of the hospital's resources.
"Specifically to improve the health service coverage of West Java residents, our Universe Health service is accomodated through the Layad Care Services and Integrated Referral System in stages," Berli said, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
Regarding the ideal number of hospitals, Berli did not explain in detail.



Only six hospitals
The West Java DPRD highlighted the lack of hospitals in the West Java Provincial Government. At present, the West Java Provincial Government Hospital is only six with uneven distribution.
West Java DPRD Commission V member Asep Wahyuwijaya said, the West Java DPRD had actually encouraged the executive to add to the RSUD. The proposed addition of RSUD, said Asep, appeared to increase the accessibility of public health services, especially for people in areas far from the city center.
"Supposedly, the West Java Health Service also proactively asked the governor that the provincial hospitals be added so that the health coverage of West Java residents can be served. Now (there are only six provincial hospitals), three of them are Pameungpeuk Garut Regional Hospital, Al Ihsan Regional Hospital of Bandung Regency, and Regional Hospital in Jampang Kulon Sukabumi, "Asep said, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
He urged the West Java Provincial Government to provide provincial hospitals in other locations. Asep pointed out, in Bogor Regency there must be a Regional Hospital that serves 2 million residents.
"The fundamental rights of the community in the health sector must continue to be optimized. The West Java Provincial Government, through the policy of the Governor of West Java Ridwan Kamil, should prioritize the fulfillment of the basic rights of the community, do not allocate a budget for the pupujieun program whose impact is less felt by the community, "he said. ***
